verses.text: 施洗約翰（可1:3~8；路3:2~17；約1:19~28）那時，施洗的約翰出來，在猶太的曠野傳道，

words.note: Lit. 'John who baptizes'
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Mark.
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Luke.
Abbreviation for the Gospel of John.
Lit. 'John who baptizes'.
Lit. 'transmit the Way/Truth'.

verses.text: 說：「天國近了，你們應當悔改。」
以賽亞先知所說：「在曠野有呼喊者的聲音：『預備主的道，修直他的路！』」就是指著這約翰說的。

words.note: 所 often marks the object of a verb or forms a nominalized clause.
者 turns the verb '呼喊' into a noun, 'the one who cries out'.
Often capitalized in Christian texts.
的 nominalizes the preceding verb to form a descriptive clause.

verses.text: 約翰身穿駱駝毛的衣服，腰束皮帶，吃的是蝗蟲和野蜜。
耶路撒冷、猶太全地和約旦河一帶的人都出來到他那裡去，
承認自己的罪，在約旦河裡受了他的洗。

words.note: Often used as a locative suffix after nouns.
Refers to baptism in this context.

verses.text: 約翰看見許多法利賽人和撒都該人也來受他的洗，就對他們說：「毒蛇所生的啊，誰指示你們逃避那將要來的忿怒呢？

words.note: Indicates the agent or passive action, forming a noun phrase with the verb.
Here, it forms 'those born of' from '所生'.

verses.text: 應當結出果子來，與悔改的心相稱。

words.note: Indicates outward direction or coming into being.

verses.text: 你們心裡不要以為：『我們有亞伯拉罕作我們的祖宗。』我告訴你們，　神能從這些石頭中給亞伯拉罕興起後裔來。

words.note: Indicates coming into being or a resulting state.

verses.text: 現在斧頭已經放在樹根上，所有不結好果子的樹，就砍下來，丟在火裡。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here.
Connects a descriptive phrase to a noun, like 'trees that do not bear good fruit'.
Often used as a locative suffix after nouns.

verses.text: 我用水給你們施洗，表示你們悔改；但在我以後要來的那一位，能力比我更大，我就是替他提鞋也沒有資格。他要用聖靈與火給你們施洗。

words.note: Lit. 'bestow washing'.
Lit. 'regret and change'.
An idiom referring to a menial servant's task.

verses.text: 他手裡拿著簸箕，要揚淨麥場，把麥子收進倉裡，卻用不滅的火把糠秕燒盡。」

words.note: A tool used for separating grain from chaff.
To separate grain from chaff by wind.
A place where grain is threshed and winnowed.
Lit. 'not extinguishable'.
Refers to worthless husks separated from grain.

verses.text: 耶穌受洗（可1:9~11；路3:21~22）那時，耶穌從加利利來到約旦河約翰那裡，要受他的洗。

words.note: Abbreviation for the Gospel of Mark (馬可福音).
Abbreviation for the Gospel of Luke (路加福音).
Here, 'wash' as a noun, referring to baptism.

verses.text: 約翰想要阻止他，說：「我應該受你的洗，你卻到我這裡來嗎？」
耶穌回答：「暫且這樣作吧。我們理當這樣履行全部的義。」於是約翰答應了他。

words.note: Implies acting according to reason or divine principle.
In a biblical context, often refers to divine justice or righteousness.

verses.text: 耶穌受了洗，立刻從水中上來；忽然，天為他開了，他看見　神的靈，好像鴿子降下來，落在他身上；

words.note: Lit. 'receive washing/baptism'
Refers to the Holy Spirit here.

verses.text: 又有聲音從天上來，說：「這是我的愛子，我所喜悅的。」

words.note: A specific theological term for Christ.
Indicates the object of the following verb or forms a nominal phrase.
Forms 'the one whom I am pleased with'.
